intro: Protea intonsa, commonly known as the silver protea, is a striking South African plant belonging to the Proteaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy inflorescence composed of many small, tubular flowers arranged in a spherical or conical shape. The plant typically grows in coastal regions, where it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Its foliage consists of broad, leathery leaves that are often covered in a silvery-white powdery coating. Protea intonsa is a popular ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators like birds and insects.
